result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mark A. Reyna Jr.

records.addlTxt: to Withdraw as Counsel of Record--Fischer

Pre-trial conference on October 5, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Status conference on November 14, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

[ma] Case called at 8:49am [Court Reporter: Lori Schiek]
Defendant Mark A. Reyna Jr. in court.  Attorney Joseph Francis Fischer in court for Mark A. Reyna Jr.  Attorney Monica Hall in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Officer Brandon Hanley -sworn & testifies
--direct examination by DA Hall
--cross examination by Attorney Fischer 

Atty Fischer requests Count #1 be dismissed. 

The Court finds probable cause that Mr. Reyna committed a felony. The Court binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered
--in response to the Court's inquiry, both counsel indicate that they are not requesting speedy trial.
recess: 9:09am 

NEXT:  (1) Pretrial Conference on 10/5/22 at 1:00pm   (2) Status Conference on 11/14/22 at 3:00pm
Preliminary hearing on September 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.

[ml] Case called at 8:55AM
Defendant Mark A. Reyna Jr. in court with Attorney Joseph Francis Fischer. ADA Michael Witt appears for the State of Wisconsin.
This file is scheduled for a Preliminary Hearing, however the State's Officer Witness does not appear.
The State advises that it cannot raise its witness. Att Fischer voices displeasure in this, but takes no position this hearing being rescheduled.
The Court admonishes the State and its witness for not appearing today. 
The Court finds good cause to reschedule the Preliminary Hearing.

recess 9:03AM

NEXT: Preliminary Hearing on 09/06 at 8:30AM with in person appearances
to Surety - per 7/11/22 court order. 22C 014182
Scheduling Order

Pre-trial conference on July 27, 2022 at 03:40 pm.
Preliminary hearing on August 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Bond Payment information
Amended Bond

[MK] case called at 1:16pm  
Defendant Mark A. Reyna in court with Attorney Joseph Fischer.  Public Service Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.

Attorney Flint verifies victim rights compliance.  The victim is present and makes a statement regarding conditions of bond.  
The Court requires a $2,500 Signature Bond, with conditions: 
--not to make any acts or threats of violence
--no contact with Victim 1 except for communications through Our Family Wizard on the account set up and funded by the victim; communications on Our Family Wizard are only allowed in regard to custody and placeement and child-exchange decisions; communication is to be done in a respectful manner.  Child-exchanges will be conducted at the Jefferson County Sheriff's Office 
--no presence at Victim 1's residence 

The Court directs that the posted $650 cash bail is to be refunded to the person who posted the amount. 
recess 1:27pm 

NEXT:   (1) Pretrial Conference on July 27th at 3:40pm--only counsel need to appear,   (2) Preliminary Hearing on August 18th at 8:30am
